item.title: Random Variables
item.description: Random variables - RV Random variables are ways to map outcomes of random processes to numbers. For examples: Flipping a coin: X = {0 if head, 1 if tail} Sum of upward face after rolling 7 dice Discrete and continous RV Discrete: distinct/separate value: X = {0 heads, 1 tails} X = Year that a random student was born X = # of ants born tomorrow X = Execution time of a program every time it get executed (rounded to the nearest miliseconds).
